intro: Serjania confertiflora f. subincana, commonly known as the white serjania, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has a woody stem and broad, ovate leaves with a smooth surface. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates and is often found in moist, shaded areas. The flowers are primarily pollinated by insects, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
